keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, signaling strong diplomatic backlash over U.S. actions involving drug-related operations.
The recall follows a previous diplomatic incident in July when the U.S. recalled its ambassador to Colombia, indicating a recurring pattern of strained relations.
President Gustavo Petro Urrego of Colombia accused U.S. President Donald Trump of supporting a plot to remove him from power, which the White House dismissed as baseless.
President Trump accused Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to halt large-scale payments and subsidies to Colombia, citing its failure to combat drug production.
The U.S. has launched missile attacks on seven alleged drug-smuggling vessels in the Caribbean, resulting in at least 30 deaths, with Petro claiming some victims were Colombian citizens.
A Colombian citizen aboard the most recent vessel attacked was returned safely to Colombia, highlighting concerns over the impact of U.S. actions on Colombian nationals.
The U.S. administration plans to raise tariffs on Colombian exports, which could affect Colombia’s economy and trade relations.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, in response to U.S. military actions, including missile attacks on alleged drug-smuggling vessels in the Caribbean, and accusations from U.S. President Donald Trump that President Gustavo Petro is an 'illegal drug leader' and that Colombia has failed to combat drug production. This marks the second time in 2025 that the Colombian ambassador has been recalled, following a prior U.S. recall of its ambassador in July. The situation has deepened diplomatic tensions, with Petro accusing the U.S. of political interference and human rights violations, while Trump threatens to impose economic sanctions, including higher tariffs, on Colombian exports. The attacks have resulted in at least 30 deaths, with some victims reportedly being Colombian citizens, further fueling accusations that the U.S. is violating Colombian sovereignty.
title: Colombian ambassador to US recalled to Bogotá for consultations, embassy says
